alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc; Outagamie; Shawano; Southern Oconto County; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 6:23PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS ACROSS PORTIONS OF EAST-CENTRAL WISCONSIN DURING THE EARLY EVENING... At 605 pm, radar indicated a band of snow across east-central Wisconsin. The heaviest snow, falling at a rate of up to 1 inch per hour and reducing the visibility to less than 1/4 mile at times was generally east of a line from Oshkosh to Appleton to Green Bay to Sturgeon Bay. It continued to push east, and will affect areas from Green Bay to the Lakeshore for the next hour or two. Travel conditions in areas affected by the heavy snow band were very hazardous, with numerous collisions and slide-offs reported. Light to occasionally moderate snow extended back farther west, to about the Wautoma, Waupaca, and Clintonville areas. The entire area of snow will continue to move east, and should exit the area and be out over Lake Michigan by late evening. A total snowfall of 1 to 4 inches is expected, with the highest totals south and east of the city of Green Bay. Poor travel conditions are expected across the area this evening, with very hazardous travel conditions likely from Green Bay to the lakeshore during the next couple hours. Anyone traveling in east-central Wisconsin should plan on a much slower than normal trip and allow plenty of extra time to reach their destination.
